intro: Vernonia erlangeriana, commonly known as the erlanger's ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as coastal areas and riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
